content: To what extent might we be able to provide raw survey data, in cases where doing so cannot expose private or sensitive information? I've really appreciated how the StackOverflow survey provides most of the raw data as CSV files, allowing for people to do their own analyses. We can't provide free-text answers, and some correlations might be sensitive, but at a minimum perhaps we could give raw separate columnar data for purely multiple-choice fields?
Iâ€™m not sure. We can check with the foundation legal counsel as the survey data is officially under the stewardship of the foundation
